chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Ray Smith Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Ray Smith Jr.

records.addlTxt:
9:15 AM Defendant Johnny Ray Smith Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Johnny Ray Smith Jr.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court reviews the court record and indicates speedy trial demand was requested, and if the plea/sentencing takes place, the jury trial will be removed from calendar.  Plea Questionnaire completed by telephone, DEF signed in court and submitted to Court today.   State recites agreement.  All parties agree.    State request court to Amend Information on Count 1 to 961.41(3g)(am) Possession to Narcotic Drugs and Count 2  to 961.41(1m(e)1 - Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine <3 grams and removal of second and subsequent offense.   Court grants request and moves to amend Count 1 and Count 2.   Court reviews the amended Counts in Information, DEF enters NC Plea to Count 1 and 2.   DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   Court accepts plea to Amended Counts 1 and 2, and finds DEF guilty to Count 1 and 2.    Count 3 and 4 are dismissed and read in.  State makes statement prior to sentencing.  Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with.     Attny Thomas-Schmidt makes statement to court prior to sentencing.   DEF makes statement to court.  Court addresses the DEF.   Court to follow the agreement.    Jury Trial removed from calendar.  

COURT:

COUNT 1:  180 days county jail.  Good time and Huber privileges.  120 days credit.  Court Costs.  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge. 

COUNT 2:  Withheld Sentence:  5 years probation:  Conditions of Probation:  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.   Fine/Costs $1,079.25  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.   Probation term consecutive to Jail Sentence in  Count 1.
Plea hearing on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:04 PM Defendant Johnny Ray Smith Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Johnny Ray Smith Jr.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Thomas-Schmidt indicates to proceed with Jury Trial.  Court orders, Witness List, Special Verdict Forms, Jury Instructions to be filed by Tuesday, October 4, 2022.    Last day for resolution is Wednesday, October 12, 2022 by noon.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on October 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Final pre-trial on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:38 AM Defendant Johnny Ray Smith Jr. appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Johnny Ray Smith Jr.   Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Thomas-Schmidt to schedule speedy trial in Case 22CF153,  Tracking with case 22CF153.

11:38 AM Defendant Johnny Ray Smith Jr. appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Johnny Ray Smith Jr.   Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Thomas-Schmidt acknowledges information, waives reading. Through Attny  DEF enters NG plea, and requests speedy trial.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.    Attny Thomas-Schmidt to schedule speedy trial with JA.

11:20 AM Defendant Johnny Ray Smith Jr. appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail, with Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt, appearing in person.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Thomas-Schmidt wishes to proceed with preliminary hearing.  11:21AM  State calls witness Deputy Casey Culhane.  Court swears in witness.  State questions witness.  11:23AM Witness identifies DEF.  State continues questioning witness.  11:27AM  State tenders witness.   Atty Thomas-Schmidt cross-examines witness.  11:28 AM Witness excused.  State has no additional witnesses.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt has no witnesses. 
 State makes no argument, requests bind over.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.  Court sets ARGN for 7/18/22 at 11AM.
Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:20 AM Defendant Johnny Ray Smith Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten (Special Appearance) appeared by video for Johnny Ray Smith Jr.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea to counts 3 and 4.  Court sets for preliminary hearing within time limits.  Bond Continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 8:42 AM Defendant  Johnny Ray Smith Jr.  in court, in custody appears by video.  Attny Gabriel Pollak  (special appearance) appears in court.  Kenneth  Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State indicates reports received and requests initial appearance to be set. Court sets.

11:18 am Defendant  Johnny Ray Smith Jr  in court, in custody appears by video.  Attny Gabriel Pollak  (special appearance) appear in court, by video.  Kenneth  Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Probable Cause found by court. DE does qualify for PD appointment.   State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Pollak argues bond.  Court sets bond.  CBS $25,000 ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.    INITIAL APPEARANCE set for  June 14, 2022 @ 8:30 AM
